main event: A close approach of an unidentified bright white light object was observed at 19/07/32. The object was zigzaging, dipping and rising at varying speeds and made a sudden and instantaneous turn.
interesting points: The observers could not decide if the object was distant or close in sight.
Daily sightings of the object occurred over a 5 year period.
The object was observed at two different times on the same day, 19/07/32 and 19/2120Z, and exhibited different brightness levels.
The object was observed in pairs in echelon formation and also in a trail formation of 4 objects.
The object exhibited high speeds and instantaneous turns, convincing the observer that the sightings were not of normal aircraft.
